intro: Anisora murrii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming compact rosettes of leaves. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are pollinated primarily by insects. Anisora murrii thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect light for optimal growth.
